IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF SENIOR ADULTS BY OFFERING THOUGHTFUL INNOVATIONS IN SERVICES FOR A VARIETY OF LIFESTYLES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME IS TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF SENIOR ADULTS THROUGH THE HIGHEST QUALITY OF SERVICES. THE ORGANIZATION'S CHARITABLE PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE MANAGEMENT, PLANNING, FINANCIAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES (SEE SCHEDULE O) EXCLUSIVELY TO ITS RELATED CCRC ORGANIZATIONAL AFFILIATES.
IRS990.Desc: WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME PROVIDES PLANNING, FINANCIAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES EXCLUSIVELY TO ITS RELATED CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONAL AFFILIATES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF SMITH CARES, LLC, A STAFFING HOLDING COMPANY. SMITH CARES PROVIDES PROFESSIONAL STAFF TO THE AFFILIATED COMPANIES OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - BEVERLY AND WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - ORLAND PARK WHEN THE INDIVIDUALS ARE SHARED BETWEEN THE TWO AFFILIATE ORGANIZATIONS.

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - BEVERLY
WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - ORLAND PARK

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION E, LINE 3A
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME APPOINT THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE OFFICERS OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - BEVERLY AND WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - ORLAND PARK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EARNINGS ON THE ASSETS OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND HAVE BEEN DESIGNATED TO SUPPORT THE CHARITABLE CARE ACTIVITIES OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - BEVERLY

THE ORGANIZATIONS THAT MAKE UP WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME QUALIFY AS TAX-EXEMPT CORPORATIONS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) AND ARE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(A) OF THE IRC. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT WOULD JEOPARDIZE ITS TAX EXEMPT STATUS. SHOULD THAT STATUS BE CHALLENGED IN THE FUTURE, ALL OPEN YEARS COULD BE SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS).

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH COMMUNITY - BEVERLY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME EVALUATES AND ESTABLISHES COMPENSATION AND REVIEWS PROTOCOL FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO AND CFO. ANNUAL COMPENSATION COMPARISONS TO INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS ARE GATHERED AND REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. DECISIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETING MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S INTERNAL MANAGEMENT AND THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE RETURN WITH ITS PAID TAX PREPARER. AFTER REVIEW, COPIES OF THE FULL FORM 990 ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY ALL TRUSTEES, CORPORATE OFFICERS, EXECUTIVE AND KEY PERSONNAL ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE FOR CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THE DISCLOSURES ARE SUMMARIZED BY THE CFO AND REVIEWED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE WHO DETERMINES IF A POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. IF A POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS THE TRUSTEE IS REQUIRED TO RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM ANY VOTING, DELIBERATION, OR DECISION ON THE TRANSACTION AT THE BOARD LEVEL. FURTHERMORE, ALL VENDOR PAYMENT ACTIVITY IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO FOR VENDORS THAT MAY BE RELATED TO THE FILING ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME EVALUATES AND ESTABLISHES COMPENSATION AND REVIEWS PROTOCOL FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO AND CFO. ANNUAL COMPENSATION COMPARISONS TO INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS ARE GATHERED AND REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. DECISIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETING MINUTES. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW WAS COMPLETED IN OCTOBER 2021. THE CEO OF WASHINGTON AND JANE SMITH HOME DETERMINES THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION OF ALL OTHER OFFICERS, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE CFO, BY COMPARING THE COMPENSATION OF EACH OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO PROFESSIONALS PERFORMING SIMILAR SERVICES IN SIMILAR INDUSTRIES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW WAS COMPLETED IN JULY 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE NOT REQUIRED DISCLOSURES PURSUANT TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) SECTION 6104. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THIS TIME.
